verses.kjv: Woe to Ariel, to Ariel, the city where David dwelt! add ye year to year; let them kill sacrifices.
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for Ariel, Ariel — the city where David made his home! Go ahead, let another year pass, keep celebrating your festivals.

verses.kjv: Yet I will distress Ariel, and there shall be heaviness and sorrow: and it shall be unto me as Ariel.
verses.ct: But I will bring trouble on Ariel, and there will be grief and mourning. The city will truly become an altar hearth to me.

verses.kjv: And I will camp against thee round about, and will lay siege against thee with a mount, and I will raise forts against thee.
verses.ct: I will surround you on every side, I will besiege you with siege works, and I will build up assault towers against you.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt be brought down, and shalt speak out of the ground, and thy speech shall be low out of the dust, and thy voice shall be, as of one that hath a familiar spirit, out of the ground, and thy speech shall whisper out of the dust.
verses.ct: You will be brought low, speaking from the ground itself, your words muffled in the dirt. Your voice will come up from the earth like a ghost's whisper, and your speech will barely rise from the dust.

verses.kjv: Moreover the multitude of thy strangers shall be like small dust, and the multitude of the terrible ones shall be as chaff that passeth away: yea, it shall be at an instant suddenly.
verses.ct: But the hordes of your enemies will become like fine powder, and the masses of ruthless attackers will scatter like blown chaff. It will happen in a sudden instant.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt be visited of the LORD of hosts with thunder, and with earthquake, and great noise, with storm and tempest, and the flame of devouring fire.
verses.ct: The LORD of Armies will intervene with thunder, earthquakes, and tremendous noise — with windstorms, violent gales, and flames of consuming fire.

verses.kjv: And the multitude of all the nations that fight against Ariel, even all that fight against her and her munition, and that distress her, shall be as a dream of a night vision.
verses.ct: Then all the nations that wage war against Ariel — everyone who attacks her fortifications and brings her distress — will vanish like a dream in the night.

verses.kjv: It shall even be as when an hungry man dreameth, and, behold, he eateth; but he awaketh, and his soul is empty: or as when a thirsty man dreameth, and, behold, he drinketh; but he awaketh, and, behold, he is faint, and his soul hath appetite: so shall the multitude of all the nations be, that fight against mount Zion.
verses.ct: It will be like when a hungry person dreams of eating, but wakes up still starving. Or like when a thirsty person dreams of drinking, but wakes up parched and desperate. That is what will happen to the masses of nations that fight against Mount Zion.

verses.kjv: Stay yourselves, and wonder; cry ye out, and cry: they are drunken, but not with wine; they stagger, but not with strong drink.
verses.ct: Go ahead, be stunned and amazed! Blind yourselves and stay blind! They are drunk, but not from wine. They stumble around, but not from alcohol.

verses.kjv: For the LORD hath poured out upon you the spirit of deep sleep, and hath closed your eyes: the prophets and your rulers, the seers hath he covered.
verses.ct: The LORD has poured over you a spirit of deep sleep. He has shut your eyes — the prophets — and covered your heads — the visionaries.

verses.kjv: And the vision of all is become unto you as the words of a book that is sealed, which men deliver to one that is learned, saying, Read this, I pray thee: and he saith, I cannot; for it is sealed:
verses.ct: Every vision has become to you like the words of a sealed scroll. When someone hands it to an educated person and says, 'Please read this,' they reply, 'I can't — it's sealed.'

verses.kjv: And the book is delivered to him that is not learned, saying, Read this, I pray thee: and he saith, I am not learned.
verses.ct: Then when the scroll is handed to someone uneducated and they're told, 'Please read this,' they reply, 'I don't know how to read.'

verses.kjv: Wherefore the Lord said, Forasmuch as this people draw near me with their mouth, and with their lips do honour me, but have removed their heart far from me, and their fear toward me is taught by the precept of men:
verses.ct: Therefore the Lord said, 'These people come close to me with their words and honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far away from me. Their worship of me is nothing but human rules that they've memorized.

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, I will proceed to do a marvellous work among this people, even a marvellous work and a wonder: for the wisdom of their wise men shall perish, and the understanding of their prudent men shall be hid.
verses.ct: So pay attention — I am going to do something astonishing among these people, something truly astonishing and extraordinary. The wisdom of their wise will disappear, and the insight of their most intelligent people will be hidden away.'

verses.kjv: Woe unto them that seek deep to hide their counsel from the LORD, and their works are in the dark, and they say, Who seeth us? and who knoweth us?
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for those who go to great lengths to hide their plans from the LORD, who carry out their schemes in the dark and say, 'Who can see us? Who will know?'

verses.kjv: Surely your turning of things upside down shall be esteemed as the potter’s clay: for shall the work say of him that made it, He made me not? or shall the thing framed say of him that framed it, He had no understanding?
verses.ct: How you twist things around! Should the clay be treated as equal to the potter? Can something that was made say about its maker, 'He didn't make me'? Can something that was shaped say about the one who shaped it, 'He doesn't understand anything'?

verses.kjv: Is it not yet a very little while, and Lebanon shall be turned into a fruitful field, and the fruitful field shall be esteemed as a forest?
verses.ct: In just a very short time, won't Lebanon be transformed into fertile farmland, and what is now fertile farmland will seem like a dense forest?

verses.kjv: And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity, and out of darkness.
verses.ct: On that day, deaf people will hear the words of the scroll, and the eyes of the blind will see through the gloom and darkness.

verses.kjv: The meek also shall increase their joy in the LORD, and the poor among men shall rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
verses.ct: The humble will find increasing joy in the LORD, and the poorest people will celebrate because of the Holy One of Israel.

verses.kjv: For the terrible one is brought to nought, and the scorner is consumed, and all that watch for iniquity are cut off:
verses.ct: The ruthless will be gone, the mockers will disappear, and everyone who schemes to do evil will be eliminated —

verses.kjv: That make a man an offender for a word, and lay a snare for him that reproveth in the gate, and turn aside the just for a thing of nought.
verses.ct: those who condemn a person over a single word, who set traps for anyone who speaks up for justice at the city gate, and who use lies to deny the innocent their rights.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD, who redeemed Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob, Jacob shall not now be ashamed, neither shall his face now wax pale.
verses.ct: So this is what the LORD, who redeemed Abraham, says about the house of Jacob: 'Jacob will no longer be ashamed, and his face will no longer grow pale with fear.

verses.kjv: But when he seeth his children, the work of mine hands, in the midst of him, they shall sanctify my name, and sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and shall fear the God of Israel.
verses.ct: When he sees his children — the work of my hands — among his people, they will honor my name as holy. They will honor the Holy One of Jacob as holy and deeply revere the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: They also that erred in spirit shall come to understanding, and they that murmured shall learn doctrine.
verses.ct: Those who wandered in confusion will gain understanding, and those who complained will accept instruction.'
